Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid reversal, sequence shuffling, designed

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toretro-FK13K: 42%, R: 33%, I: 17%.Activity:  active against E. coli (MIC 5 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 10 uM), S. aureus (MIC 10 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 5 uM). Warning: Non-standard assay.Structure:  like retroFK-13, retroKR-12 is also helical determined by NMR.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Gunasekera S, Muhammad T, Strömstedt AA, Rosengren KJ, Göransson U.2020
Literature Information.Title: Backbone Cyclization and Dimerization of LL-37-Derived Peptides Enhance Antimicrobial Activity and Proteolytic Stability.
